message:
Who has experience with HTML scraping?
Here's the problem: there's an application that puts out reports as web pages, and I'd like to scrape those pages to get that information in another format (XML, JSON, etc).
I've done some research and found a number of libraries and each one is described as "amazing", "the only library you need", etc.
So, I'm looking for recommendation for a library that is easy to use and hopefully works with .NET
Thanks

data.message: Did you try any node.js modules ? I guess I saw modules do similar functionality

Libraries I've seen: 
HtmlAgilityPack: it's more for parsing HTML. I found I have to do a lot of work to get to anything meaningful.
http://htmlagilitypack.codeplex.com/
BeautifulSoup (Python)
http://www.crummy.com/software/BeautifulSoup/

http://blog.miguelgrinberg.com/post/easy-web-scraping-with-nodejs

http://scotch.io/tutorials/javascript/scraping-the-web-with-node-js

Try these and please let me know if any of them worked also when I'm at PC I look for more

I used HTML Agility Pack several times long time ago, it was straight forward, the performance was acceptable and does not break when the HTML is messy, I would use it again if the web pages I am going to scrap have similar DOM hierarchy and don't have dynamic content loaded on client-side
Me, I scrapped all Yellow Pages :) using rails and gem file "Nokogiri". my script was only around 40 lines written in ruby and saves the output in a csv file :)

tl;dr: Use the last link

Long:
There are 2 parts: crawling the site & scraping HTML. HTML Agility pack (.net), BeautifulSoup (Python), lxml (Python), cheerio (Node) are concerned about scraping HTML only. The hard part is crawling.

Crawling is an IO-bound operation. If you want to fetch few pages, you can use Python for this. If you want to scale to 100s of pages, then you _have_ to use async programming.

This is an example of scraping bey2ollak[1] and this is a more scalable example searching for dead links in a given website[2]

[1] https://github.com/mtayseer/bey2ollak_scraping
[2] https://github.com/mtayseer/dead_links_crawler/blob/master/dead_links_crawler.js

That's funny. I already wrote a .NET app that does the crawling. That was the easy part for me because the URL is straightforward.
I'm liking Cheerio so far.
If the URL is straight forward, then bey2ollak scraping is closer to what you need
you might also want to take a look at phantom js or slimer js which both gives you scriptable headless web browser using js
